description.narrative: Madini Yetu Wajibu Wetu (Our minerals Our Rights) project is implemented by a partner consortium of Seven organisations (National Council of Churches of Kenya- NCCK, Kenya Human Rights  Comission, Caritus Kitui, GROOTS Kenya, Kenya Conferenrce of Catholic Bishops, Econews Africa and Inuka Kenya ni sisi).The project aims promoting responsible steardship of resources from the Extractive Industry/ Mining Industry by enhancing the capacities of comunities in and around mining areas in Kenya to effectively participate and benefit from the sector; advocating for development of  laws that take into account community interests ; engaging the private sector in respecting human rights in the mining cycle and practicing fair distribution of opportunities in the sector. Groots Kenya will particularly focus on the Artisinal and small scale miners (ASM) in Kakamega  County where gold mining is currently ongoing. This project  will also focus enhancing the capacity of women in these communities to effectively participate in decion making processes and also benefit from the sector.Communities and particularly women will be able to demand just compensation, benefit sharing, resettlement  relocation agreements;the Artisanal miners will be more organized into welfare groups and are able to articulate their issues of concern. The entrepreneurial  capacity of women in the ES and other diversified economic sectors will also be greatly enhanced.
This project mainly contributes to results within Fair distribution of wealth and access to natural resources. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
